Crimes.Crime_Name: Residing without status in the United States
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the officer's refusal of the humanitarian and compassionate application was procedurally fair, unbiased, legally correct, and reasonable
Crimes.Standard_of_Review: Correctness for legal questions; reasonableness for factual or discretionary decisions
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: No breach of procedural fairness found; applicants had opportunity to present case but failed to provide significant new information
Crimes.Review_Standard: Reasonableness applied to factual assessments; correctness for legal questions
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), particularly s. 25(1) on humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged procedural unfairness, bias, incorrect legal test, and unreasonable decision
Crimes.Applicable_Process: Humanitarian and Compassionate (H&C) application process under IRPA
Crimes.Legal_Rule_Source: IRPA, Federal Court jurisprudence on H&C applications
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicants to demonstrate unusual, undeserved, or disproportionate hardship
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Applicants’ failure to update information reduced weight of claims
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Officer relied on country condition reports and applicant submissions
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Administrative decision-making under Canadian immigration law
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Claimed lack of procedural fairness and misapplication of legal test
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Officer properly exercised discretion based on available evidence
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Foreign nationals previously residing in the U.S. without status
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Residing illegally in the U.S., prior failed refugee claim in Canada
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicants lived illegally in the U.S., claimed refugee status in Canada unsuccessfully, then sought H&C relief

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the officer breached procedural fairness, applied incorrect legal tests, or made an unreasonable decision
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Procedural fairness requires disclosure of adverse evidence; reasonableness standard applies to factual findings
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Hardship, family ties, establishment, children's interests
Evidence_Used: Lack of updated information from applicants
Crimes.Review_Standard: Reasonableness for factual assessments; correctness for legal interpretation
Crimes.Application_Basis: Humanitarian and compassionate grounds under IRPA s. 25(1)
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to provide new or compelling evidence of hardship
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: No unusual or disproportionate hardship established
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Alleged lack of opportunity to respond to extrinsic evidence
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Officer considered publicly available country reports without requiring applicant response
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA s. 25(1) – failure to meet threshold for H&C relief
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Applicants overstayed their visas in Canada
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Applied policy guidelines and assessed all relevant factors
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Stay in Canada on humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Crimes.Violation_Type: Failure to maintain legal status after visa expiration
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicants remained in Canada beyond authorized period and sought H&C relief
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal Court jurisdiction over immigration decisions
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: No obligation on officer to solicit updated information

Crimes.Crime_Name: Making false statements in an application (potential, based on refusals to provide updates or discrepancies)
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the officer breached procedural fairness by not allowing applicants to update their application
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: No breach; burden is on applicant to submit complete information
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Applicants failed to demonstrate expectation or entitlement to provide updates
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to proactively submit new information
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Expectation to provide updated information during processing
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Absence of material new evidence that would affect outcome
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Humanitarian and Compassionate application with subsequent judicial review
Crimes.Application_Error: Assumption that officer would request updates
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None found; officer reviewed all submitted materials
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Duty of procedural fairness does not require officers to solicit missing information
Crimes.Application_Factor: Timeliness and completeness of applicant submissions
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Alleged procedural unfairness due to lack of update opportunity
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA s. 25(1), s. 40(1); Federal Courts Rules
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Insufficient hardship evidence and failure to update file
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: No duty to update absent request
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Not applicable — no forged documents, but potential omission
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claimed implied right to update application
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Timing and method of submitting additional information

Crimes.Crime_Name: Illegal entry into the United States
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the officer breached procedural fairness, applied incorrect legal test, or made unreasonable decision
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Post-refugee claim H&C application following illegal presence in U.S.
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicants’ history of unauthorized stay and failed claims weighed against credibility
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Refugee claim records, H&C application, country reports
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Request for permanent residence on H&C grounds despite irregular migration history
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of unusual, undeserved, or disproportionate hardship
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to establish sufficient hardship despite family and child factors
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Unusual, undeserved, or disproportionate hardship required under H&C
Crimes.Application_Factor: Length of stay in Canada, integration, children’s welfare
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Fairness, legality, and reasonableness of refusal
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Reliance on public country reports without direct notice to applicants
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Met — no duty to disclose non-adverse extrinsic evidence
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Argument that children’s best interests were undervalued
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Use of extrinsic evidence in decision-making
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Prior illegal stay in U.S., failed refugee claim

Crimes.Crime_Name: Border document misrepresentation (if any documentation was misrepresented during entry attempts)
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the officer breached procedural fairness or made an unreasonable decision
Crimes.Procedural_Context: H&C application following allegations of document or statement inconsistencies
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicants failed to prove they were misled or expected to update info
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Application forms, affidavits, border entry records
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Alleged expectation to correct information post-submission
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Absence of material discrepancy or proven misrepresentation
Crimes.Application_Error: Assumption that updates would be solicited
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Procedural fairness and correct application of H&C criteria
Crimes.Application_Factor: Completeness and accuracy of initial submission
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: No unusual hardship demonstrated; insufficient evidence of misrepresentation impact
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: No requirement to allow supplemental submissions
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Satisfied — applicants responsible for full disclosure
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Not confirmed, but potential for misrepresentation via omission
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Inconsistencies in narrative or failure to disclose
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claimed procedural unfairness due to lack of update mechanism
